title: Actress Heather Graham Lists Longtime Hollywood Home for $2.85 Million
text:
Text size

Actress Heather Graham has put her longtime Hollywood home on the market for $2.85 million.

Ms. Graham bought the Beachwood Canyon house located below the iconic Hollywood sign in 1998 for $880,000, according to property records.

The three-floor Spanish-style villa was built in 1927, and according to the listing, was once owned by the novelist Zane Grey, whose 1912 western tome “Riders of the Purple Sage” was a bestseller.The estate was listed on Sept. 30 by Elisabeth Halsted of Berkshire Hathaway HomeServices California Properties.

The three-bedroom, five-bathroom house has a wood-paneled library, a living room with a wood-burning fireplace, an eat-in chef’s kitchen and a porch room. Its tiers of gardens lead to a grassy lawn, a patio with a built-in barbecue, a vegetable garden, a swimming pool, a spa and a fire pit. The 9,000-square-foot property also includes a carriage-house-style two-car garage.

“It’s a very romantic and dreamy estate with magical views of the canyon,” Ms. Halsted said. “It feels like a mini-estate. It’s very private; it feels like it’s being taken care of by the canyon.”

She added that although the villa has been updated, “it is very coveted because the original character and charm and details, such as the clay-tiled roof, are still there.”

Ms. Graham’s publicist said she did not want to be interviewed for the story.

Ms. Graham, who is 49, began her career in commercials. Her first starring role was in 1988 in the teen comedy “License to Drive.” Her career took off in 1989, when she starred in “Drugstore Cowboy.”

She has had supporting roles in a number of films, including “Shout” (1991), “Diggstown”(1992), “Six Degrees of Separation” (1993) and “Swingers” (1996).

In 1997’s “Boogie Nights” she played the starlet Brandy/Rollergirl, and in 1999 she co-starred in “Bowfinger” and “Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me.”

Her other films include “Committed” (2000), “Say It Isn't So” (2001), “Mary” (2005), “Gray Matters” (2007), “The Hangover” (2009) and its sequel, “The Hangover Part III” (2013).

In 2017, Ms. Graham joined a long list of actresses who detailed alleged sexual harassment by Miramax’s Harvey Weinstein. She wrote about her encounter with the movie mogul in Variety.

Developed in the 1920s, Beachwood Canyon is a community in Hollywood Hills. The scene of fleeing masses in the 1956 horror film “Invasion of the Body Snatchers” was filmed on Belden Drive, the street Ms. Graham’s house is on.

“The neighborhood is hip,” Ms. Halsted said. “It’s one of Hollywood’s creative centers; there are lots of artists, musicians and actors who live there.”

The listing was first reported by The Los Angeles Times.

This article originally appeared on Mansion Global .
description: The three-floor Spanish-style Los Angeles villa, built in 1927, was also the home of novelist Zane Grey
